devdoc.details: Interface for a fully featured Exchange Proxy.

_fillLimitOrder((address,address,uint128.details: Fill a limit order. Internal variant. ETH protocol fees can be      attached to this call. Any unspent ETH will be refunded to      `msg.sender` (not `sender`).

params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token to fill this order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

_fillOtcOrder((address,address,uint128,u.details: Fill an OTC order for up to `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.      Internal variant.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought maker tokens.
params.taker: The address to fill the order in the context of.
params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token amount to fill this        order with.
params.useSelfBalance: Whether to use the Exchange Proxy's balance        of input tokens.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much taker token was filled.

_fillRfqOrder((address,address,uint128,u.details: Fill an RFQ order. Internal variant.

params.recipient: The recipient of the maker tokens.
params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token to fill this order with.
params.useSelfBalance: Whether to use the ExchangeProxy's transient        balance of taker tokens to fill the order.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

_sellHeldTokenForTokenToUniswapV3(bytes,.details: Sell a token for another token directly against uniswap v3.      Private variant, uses tokens held by `address(this)`.

params.minBuyAmount: Minimum amount of the last token in the path to buy.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought tokens. Can be zero for sender.
params.sellAmount: amount of the first token in the path to sell.

returns.buyAmount: Amount of the last token in the path bought.

_transformERC20((address,address,address.details: Internal version of `transformERC20()`. Only callable from within.

returns.outputTokenAmount: The amount of `outputToken` received by the taker.

batchBuyERC1155s((uint8,address,address,.details: Buys multiple ERC1155 assets by filling the      given orders.

params.erc1155TokenAmounts: The amounts of the ERC1155 assets        to buy for each order.
params.revertIfIncomplete: If true, reverts if this        function fails to fill any individual order.

returns.successes: An array of booleans corresponding to whether         each order in `orders` was successfully filled.

batchBuyERC721s((uint8,address,address,u.details: Buys multiple ERC721 assets by filling the      given orders.

params.revertIfIncomplete: If true, reverts if this        function fails to fill any individual order.

returns.successes: An array of booleans corresponding to whether         each order in `orders` was successfully filled.

batchCancelERC1155Orders((uint8,address,.details: Cancel multiple ERC1155 orders. The caller should be the      maker of the orders. Silently succeeds if an order has      already been filled or cancelled.

batchCancelERC721Orders(uint256[]).details: Cancel multiple ERC721 orders by their nonces. The caller      should be the maker of the orders. Silently succeeds if      an order with the same nonce has already been filled or      cancelled.

batchCancelLimitOrders((address,address,.details: Cancel multiple limit orders. The caller must be the maker or a valid order signer.      Silently succeeds if the order has already been cancelled.

batchCancelPairLimitOrders(address[],add.details: Cancel all limit orders for a given maker and pairs with salts less      than the values provided. The caller must be the maker. Subsequent      calls to this function with the same caller and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

batchCancelPairLimitOrdersWithSigner(add.details: Cancel all limit orders for a given maker and pairs with salts less      than the values provided. The caller must be a signer registered to the maker.      Subsequent calls to this function with the same maker and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

params.maker: The maker for which to cancel.

batchCancelPairRfqOrders(address[],addre.details: Cancel all RFQ orders for a given maker and pairs with salts less      than the values provided. The caller must be the maker. Subsequent      calls to this function with the same caller and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

batchCancelPairRfqOrdersWithSigner(addre.details: Cancel all RFQ orders for a given maker and pairs with salts less      than the values provided. The caller must be a signer registered to the maker.      Subsequent calls to this function with the same maker and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

params.maker: The maker for which to cancel.

batchCancelRfqOrders((address,address,ui.details: Cancel multiple RFQ orders. The caller must be the maker or a valid order signer.      Silently succeeds if the order has already been cancelled.

returns.returnResults: The ABI-encoded results of the underlying calls.

params.revertIfIncomplete: If true, reverts if this function fails to        fill the full fill amount for any individual order.
params.signatures: Array of signatures corresponding to each order.
params.takerTokenFillAmounts: Array of desired amounts to fill each order.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmounts: Array of amounts filled, in maker token.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmounts: Array of amounts filled, in taker token.

params.revertIfIncomplete: If true, reverts if this function fails to        fill the full fill amount for any individual order.
params.signatures: Array of signatures corresponding to each order.
params.takerTokenFillAmounts: Array of desired amounts to fill each order.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmounts: Array of amounts filled, in maker token.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmounts: Array of amounts filled, in taker token.

params.makerSignatures: Array of maker signatures for each order.
params.takerSignatures: Array of taker signatures for each order.
params.unwrapWeth: Array of booleans representing whether or not         to unwrap bought WETH into ETH for each order. Should be set         to false if the maker token is not WETH.

returns.successes: Array of booleans representing whether or not         each order in `orders` was filled successfully.

batchGetLimitOrderRelevantStates((addres.details: Batch version of `getLimitOrderRelevantState()`, without reverting.      Orders that would normally cause `getLimitOrderRelevantState()`      to revert will have empty results.

returns.actualFillableTakerTokenAmounts: How much of each order is fillable         based on maker funds, in taker tokens.
returns.isSignatureValids: Whether each signature is valid for the order.

batchGetRfqOrderRelevantStates((address,.details: Batch version of `getRfqOrderRelevantState()`, without reverting.      Orders that would normally cause `getRfqOrderRelevantState()`      to revert will have empty results.

returns.actualFillableTakerTokenAmounts: How much of each order is fillable         based on maker funds, in taker tokens.
returns.isSignatureValids: Whether each signature is valid for the order.

batchMatchERC721Orders((uint8,address,ad.details: Matches pairs of complementary orders that have      non-negative spreads. Each order is filled at      their respective price, and the matcher receives      a profit denominated in the ERC20 token.

returns.profits: The amount of profit earned by the caller         of this function for each pair of matched orders         (denominated in the ERC20 token of the order pair).
returns.successes: An array of booleans corresponding to         whether each pair of orders was successfully matched.

buyERC1155((uint8,address,address,uint25.details: Buys an ERC1155 asset by filling the given order.

params.callbackData: If this parameter is non-zero, invokes        `zeroExERC1155OrderCallback` on `msg.sender` after        the ERC1155 asset has been transferred to `msg.sender`        but before transferring the ERC20 tokens to the seller.        Native tokens acquired during the callback can be used        to fill the order.
params.erc1155BuyAmount: The amount of the ERC1155 asset        to buy.

buyERC721((uint8,address,address,uint256.details: Buys an ERC721 asset by filling the given order.

params.callbackData: If this parameter is non-zero, invokes        `zeroExERC721OrderCallback` on `msg.sender` after        the ERC721 asset has been transferred to `msg.sender`        but before transferring the ERC20 tokens to the seller.        Native tokens acquired during the callback can be used        to fill the order.

cancelERC1155Order((uint8,address,addres.details: Cancel a single ERC1155 order. The caller should be the      maker of the order. Silently succeeds if the order has      already been filled or cancelled.

cancelERC721Order(uint256).details: Cancel a single ERC721 order by its nonce. The caller      should be the maker of the order. Silently succeeds if      an order with the same nonce has already been filled or      cancelled.

cancelLimitOrder((address,address,uint12.details: Cancel a single limit order. The caller must be the maker or a valid order signer.      Silently succeeds if the order has already been cancelled.

cancelPairLimitOrders(address,address,ui.details: Cancel all limit orders for a given maker and pair with a salt less      than the value provided. The caller must be the maker. Subsequent      calls to this function with the same caller and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

cancelPairLimitOrdersWithSigner(address,.details: Cancel all limit orders for a given maker and pair with a salt less      than the value provided. The caller must be a signer registered to the maker.      Subsequent calls to this function with the same maker and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

params.maker: The maker for which to cancel.

cancelPairRfqOrders(address,address,uint.details: Cancel all RFQ orders for a given maker and pair with a salt less      than the value provided. The caller must be the maker. Subsequent      calls to this function with the same caller and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

cancelPairRfqOrdersWithSigner(address,ad.details: Cancel all RFQ orders for a given maker and pair with a salt less      than the value provided. The caller must be a signer registered to the maker.      Subsequent calls to this function with the same maker and pair require the      new salt to be >= the old salt.

params.maker: The maker for which to cancel.

cancelRfqOrder((address,address,uint128,.details: Cancel a single RFQ order. The caller must be the maker or a valid order signer.      Silently succeeds if the order has already been cancelled.

createTransformWallet().details: Deploy a new flash wallet instance and replace the current one with it.      Useful if we somehow break the current wallet instance.       Only callable by the owner.

returns.returnResult: The ABI-encoded result of the underlying call.

params.impl: The implementation contract for the function.

fillLimitOrder((address,address,uint128,.details: Fill a limit order. The taker and sender will be the caller.

params.order: The limit order. ETH protocol fees can be      attached to this call. Any unspent ETH will be refunded to      the caller.
params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token amount to fill this order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

fillOrKillLimitOrder((address,address,ui.details: Fill an RFQ order for exactly `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.      The taker will be the caller. ETH protocol fees can be      attached to this call. Any unspent ETH will be refunded to      the caller.

params.takerTokenFillAmount: How much taker token to fill this order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

fillOrKillRfqOrder((address,address,uint.details: Fill an RFQ order for exactly `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.      The taker will be the caller.

params.takerTokenFillAmount: How much taker token to fill this order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

fillOtcOrder((address,address,uint128,ui.details: Fill an OTC order for up to `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.
params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token amount to fill this        order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much taker token was filled.

fillOtcOrderForEth((address,address,uint.details: Fill an OTC order for up to `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.      Unwraps bought WETH into ETH before sending it to       the taker.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.
params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token amount to fill this        order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much taker token was filled.

fillOtcOrderWithEth((address,address,uin.details: Fill an OTC order whose taker token is WETH for up      to `msg.value`.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much taker token was filled.

fillRfqOrder((address,address,uint128,ui.details: Fill an RFQ order for up to `takerTokenFillAmount` taker tokens.      The taker will be the caller.

params.takerTokenFillAmount: Maximum taker token amount to fill this order with.

returns.makerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.
returns.takerTokenFilledAmount: How much maker token was filled.

fillTakerSignedOtcOrder((address,address.details: Fully fill an OTC order. "Meta-transaction" variant,      requires order to be signed by both maker and taker.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.
params.takerSignature: The order signature from the taker.

fillTakerSignedOtcOrderForEth((address,a.details: Fully fill an OTC order. "Meta-transaction" variant,      requires order to be signed by both maker and taker.      Unwraps bought WETH into ETH before sending it to       the taker.

params.makerSignature: The order signature from the maker.
params.takerSignature: The order signature from the taker.

getERC1155OrderHash((uint8,address,addre.details: Get the canonical hash of an ERC1155 order.

getERC1155OrderInfo((uint8,address,addre.details: Get the order info for an ERC1155 order.

getERC721OrderHash((uint8,address,addres.details: Get the canonical hash of an ERC721 order.

getERC721OrderStatus((uint8,address,addr.details: Get the current status of an ERC721 order.

getERC721OrderStatusBitVector(address,ui.details: Get the order status bit vector for the given      maker address and nonce range.

params.nonceRange: Order status bit vectors are indexed        by maker address and the upper 248 bits of the        order nonce. We define `nonceRange` to be these        248 bits.

returns.bitVector: The order status bit vector for the         given maker and nonce range.

getLimitOrderHash((address,address,uint1.details: Get the canonical hash of a limit order.

getLimitOrderInfo((address,address,uint1.details: Get the order info for a limit order.

getLimitOrderRelevantState((address,addr.details: Get order info, fillable amount, and signature validity for a limit order.      Fillable amount is determined using balances and allowances of the maker.

returns.actualFillableTakerTokenAmount: How much of the order is fillable         based on maker funds, in taker tokens.

getMetaTransactionExecutedBlock((address.details: Get the block at which a meta-transaction has been executed.

returns.blockNumber: The block height when the meta-transactioin was executed.

getMetaTransactionHash((address,address,.details: Get the EIP712 hash of a meta-transaction.

getMetaTransactionHashExecutedBlock(byte.details: Get the block at which a meta-transaction hash has been executed.

returns.blockNumber: The block height when the meta-transactioin was executed.

getOtcOrderHash((address,address,uint128.details: Get the canonical hash of an OTC order.

getOtcOrderInfo((address,address,uint128.details: Get the order info for an OTC order.

getProtocolFeeMultiplier().details: Get the protocol fee multiplier. This should be multiplied by the      gas price to arrive at the required protocol fee to fill a native order.

getQuoteSigner().details: Return the optional signer for `transformERC20()` calldata.

getRfqOrderHash((address,address,uint128.details: Get the canonical hash of an RFQ order.

getRfqOrderInfo((address,address,uint128.details: Get the order info for an RFQ order.

getRfqOrderRelevantState((address,addres.details: Get order info, fillable amount, and signature validity for an RFQ order.      Fillable amount is determined using balances and allowances of the maker.

returns.actualFillableTakerTokenAmount: How much of the order is fillable         based on maker funds, in taker tokens.

getRollbackEntryAtIndex(bytes4,uint256).details: Retrieve an entry in the rollback history for a function.

params.idx: The index in the rollback history.

returns.impl: An implementation address for the function at         index `idx`.

getRollbackLength(bytes4).details: Retrieve the length of the rollback history for a function.

returns.rollbackLength: The number of items in the rollback history for         the function.

getTransformWallet().details: Return the current wallet instance that will serve as the execution      context for transformations.

getTransformerDeployer().details: Return the allowed deployer for transformers.

isValidOrderSigner(address,address).details: checks if a given address is registered to sign on behalf of a maker address

params.maker: The maker address encoded in an order (can be a contract)
params.signer: The address that is providing a signature

lastOtcTxOriginNonce(address,uint64).details: Get the last nonce used for a particular      tx.origin address and nonce bucket.

matchERC721Orders((uint8,address,address.details: Matches a pair of complementary orders that have      a non-negative spread. Each order is filled at      their respective price, and the matcher receives      a profit denominated in the ERC20 token.

returns.profit: The amount of profit earned by the caller         of this function (denominated in the ERC20 token         of the matched orders).

migrate(address,bytes,address).details: Execute a migration function in the context of the ZeroEx contract.      The result of the function being called should be the magic bytes      0x2c64c5ef (`keccack('MIGRATE_SUCCESS')`). Only callable by the owner.      The owner will be temporarily set to `address(this)` inside the call.      Before returning, the owner will be set to `newOwner`.

params.newOwner: The address of the new owner.

multiplexBatchSellEthForToken(address,(u.details: Sells attached ETH for `outputToken` using the provided      calls.

params.calls: The calls to use to sell the attached ETH.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of `outputToken` that        must be bought for this function to not revert.

multiplexBatchSellTokenForEth(address,(u.details: Sells `sellAmount` of the given `inputToken` for ETH      using the provided calls.

params.calls: The calls to use to sell the input tokens.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of ETH that        must be bought for this function to not revert.

multiplexBatchSellTokenForToken(address,.details: Sells `sellAmount` of the given `inputToken` for      `outputToken` using the provided calls.

params.calls: The calls to use to sell the input tokens.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of `outputToken`        that must be bought for this function to not revert.

multiplexMultiHopSellEthForToken(address.details: Sells attached ETH via the given sequence of tokens      and calls. `tokens[0]` must be WETH.      The last token in `tokens` is the output token that      will ultimately be sent to `msg.sender`

params.calls: The sequence of calls to use for the sell.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of output tokens that        must be bought for this function to not revert.
params.tokens: The sequence of tokens to use for the sell,        i.e. `tokens[i]` will be sold for `tokens[i+1]` via        `calls[i]`.

returns.boughtAmount: The amount of output tokens bought.

multiplexMultiHopSellTokenForEth(address.details: Sells `sellAmount` of the input token (`tokens[0]`)      for ETH via the given sequence of tokens and calls.      The last token in `tokens` must be WETH.

params.calls: The sequence of calls to use for the sell.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of ETH that        must be bought for this function to not revert.
params.tokens: The sequence of tokens to use for the sell,        i.e. `tokens[i]` will be sold for `tokens[i+1]` via        `calls[i]`.

multiplexMultiHopSellTokenForToken(addre.details: Sells `sellAmount` of the input token (`tokens[0]`)      via the given sequence of tokens and calls.      The last token in `tokens` is the output token that      will ultimately be sent to `msg.sender`

params.calls: The sequence of calls to use for the sell.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum amount of output tokens that        must be bought for this function to not revert.
params.tokens: The sequence of tokens to use for the sell,        i.e. `tokens[i]` will be sold for `tokens[i+1]` via        `calls[i]`.

returns.boughtAmount: The amount of output tokens bought.

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.details: Callback for the ERC1155 `safeTransferFrom` function.      This callback can be used to sell an ERC1155 asset if      a valid ERC1155 order, signature and `unwrapNativeToken`      are encoded in `data`. This allows takers to sell their      ERC1155 asset without first calling `setApprovalForAll`.

params.data: Additional data with no specified format. If a        valid ERC1155 order, signature and `unwrapNativeToken`        are encoded in `data`, this function will try to fill        the order using the received asset.
params.from: The address which previously owned the token.
params.tokenId: The ID of the asset being transferred.

returns.success: The selector of this function (0xf23a6e61),         indicating that the callback succeeded.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.details: Callback for the ERC721 `safeTransferFrom` function.      This callback can be used to sell an ERC721 asset if      a valid ERC721 order, signature and `unwrapNativeToken`      are encoded in `data`. This allows takers to sell their      ERC721 asset without first calling `setApprovalForAll`.

params.data: Additional data with no specified format. If a        valid ERC721 order, signature and `unwrapNativeToken`        are encoded in `data`, this function will try to fill        the order using the received asset.
params.from: The address which previously owned the token.
params.tokenId: The ID of the asset being transferred.

returns.success: The selector of this function (0x150b7a02),         indicating that the callback succeeded.

preSignERC1155Order((uint8,address,addre.details: Approves an ERC1155 order on-chain. After pre-signing      the order, the `PRESIGNED` signature type will become      valid for that order and signer.

preSignERC721Order((uint8,address,addres.details: Approves an ERC721 order on-chain. After pre-signing      the order, the `PRESIGNED` signature type will become      valid for that order and signer.

registerAllowedOrderSigner(address,bool).details: Register a signer who can sign on behalf of msg.sender      This allows one to sign on behalf of a contract that calls this function

params.allowed: True to register, false to unregister.
params.signer: The address from which you plan to generate signatures

registerAllowedRfqOrigins(address[],bool.details: Mark what tx.origin addresses are allowed to fill an order that      specifies the message sender as its txOrigin.

params.allowed: True to register, false to unregister.
params.origins: An array of origin addresses to update.

rollback(bytes4,address).details: Roll back to a prior implementation of a function.

params.targetImpl: The address of an older implementation of the function.

sellERC1155((uint8,address,address,uint2.details: Sells an ERC1155 asset to fill the given order.

params.callbackData: If this parameter is non-zero, invokes        `zeroExERC1155OrderCallback` on `msg.sender` after        the ERC20 tokens have been transferred to `msg.sender`        but before transferring the ERC1155 asset to the buyer.
params.erc1155SellAmount: The amount of the ERC1155 asset        to sell.
params.erc1155TokenId: The ID of the ERC1155 asset being        sold. If the given order specifies properties,        the asset must satisfy those properties. Otherwise,        it must equal the tokenId in the order.
params.signature: The order signature from the maker.
params.unwrapNativeToken: If this parameter is true and the        ERC20 token of the order is e.g. WETH, unwraps the        token before transferring it to the taker.

sellERC721((uint8,address,address,uint25.details: Sells an ERC721 asset to fill the given order.

params.callbackData: If this parameter is non-zero, invokes        `zeroExERC721OrderCallback` on `msg.sender` after        the ERC20 tokens have been transferred to `msg.sender`        but before transferring the ERC721 asset to the buyer.
params.erc721TokenId: The ID of the ERC721 asset being        sold. If the given order specifies properties,        the asset must satisfy those properties. Otherwise,        it must equal the tokenId in the order.
params.signature: The order signature from the maker.
params.unwrapNativeToken: If this parameter is true and the        ERC20 token of the order is e.g. WETH, unwraps the        token before transferring it to the taker.

sellEthForTokenToUniswapV3(bytes,uint256.details: Sell attached ETH directly against uniswap v3.

params.encodedPath: Uniswap-encoded path, where the first token is WETH.
params.minBuyAmount: Minimum amount of the last token in the path to buy.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought tokens. Can be zero for sender.

returns.buyAmount: Amount of the last token in the path bought.

sellToLiquidityProvider(address,address,.details: Sells `sellAmount` of `inputToken` to the liquidity provider      at the given `provider` address.

params.auxiliaryData: Auxiliary data supplied to the `provider` contract.
params.minBuyAmount: The minimum acceptable amount of `outputToken` to        buy. Reverts if this amount is not satisfied.
params.provider: The address of the on-chain liquidity provider        to trade with.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought tokens. If equal to        address(0), `msg.sender` is assumed to be the recipient.

sellToPancakeSwap(address[],uint256,uint.details: Efficiently sell directly to PancakeSwap (and forks).

sellTokenForEthToUniswapV3(bytes,uint256.details: Sell a token for ETH directly against uniswap v3.

params.encodedPath: Uniswap-encoded path, where the last token is WETH.
params.minBuyAmount: Minimum amount of ETH to buy.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought tokens. Can be zero for sender.
params.sellAmount: amount of the first token in the path to sell.

sellTokenForTokenToUniswapV3(bytes,uint2.details: Sell a token for another token directly against uniswap v3.

params.minBuyAmount: Minimum amount of the last token in the path to buy.
params.recipient: The recipient of the bought tokens. Can be zero for sender.
params.sellAmount: amount of the first token in the path to sell.

returns.buyAmount: Amount of the last token in the path bought.

setQuoteSigner(address).details: Replace the optional signer for `transformERC20()` calldata.      Only callable by the owner.

params.quoteSigner: The address of the new calldata signer.

setTransformerDeployer(address).details: Replace the allowed deployer for transformers.      Only callable by the owner.

params.transformerDeployer: The address of the new trusted deployer        for transformers.

supportInterface(bytes4).details: Indicates whether the 0x Exchange Proxy implements a particular      ERC165 interface. This function should use at most 30,000 gas.

params.interfaceId: The interface identifier, as specified in ERC165.

returns.isSupported: Whether the given interface is supported by the         0x Exchange Proxy.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new address.

params.newOwner: The address that will become the owner.

transferProtocolFeesForPools(bytes32[]).details: Transfers protocol fees from the `FeeCollector` pools into      the staking contract.

transferTrappedTokensTo(address,uint256,.details: calledFrom FundRecoveryFeature.transferTrappedTokensTo() This will be delegatecalled in the context of the Exchange Proxy instance being used.

transformERC20(address,address,uint256,u.details: Executes a series of transformations to convert an ERC20 `inputToken`      to an ERC20 `outputToken`.

params.inputToken: The token being provided by the sender.        If `0xeee...`, ETH is implied and should be provided with the call.`
params.inputTokenAmount: The amount of `inputToken` to take from the sender.
params.minOutputTokenAmount: The minimum amount of `outputToken` the sender        must receive for the entire transformation to succeed.
params.outputToken: The token to be acquired by the sender.        `0xeee...` implies ETH.
params.transformations: The transformations to execute on the token balance(s)        in sequence.

returns.outputTokenAmount: The amount of `outputToken` received by the sender.

uniswapV3SwapCallback(int256,int256,byte.details: The UniswapV3 pool swap callback which pays the funds requested      by the caller/pool to the pool. Can only be called by a valid      UniswapV3 pool.

params.data: Arbitrary data forwarded from swap() caller. An ABI-encoded        struct of: inputToken, outputToken, fee, payer

validateERC1155OrderProperties((uint8,ad.details: If the given order is buying an ERC1155 asset, checks      whether or not the given token ID satisfies the required      properties specified in the order. If the order does not      specify any properties, this function instead checks      whether the given token ID matches the ID in the order.      Reverts if any checks fail, or if the order is selling      an ERC1155 asset.

params.erc1155TokenId: The ID of the ERC1155 asset.

validateERC1155OrderSignature((uint8,add.details: Checks whether the given signature is valid for the      the given ERC1155 order. Reverts if not.

validateERC721OrderProperties((uint8,add.details: If the given order is buying an ERC721 asset, checks      whether or not the given token ID satisfies the required      properties specified in the order. If the order does not      specify any properties, this function instead checks      whether the given token ID matches the ID in the order.      Reverts if any checks fail, or if the order is selling      an ERC721 asset.

params.erc721TokenId: The ID of the ERC721 asset.

validateERC721OrderSignature((uint8,addr.details: Checks whether the given signature is valid for the      the given ERC721 order. Reverts if not.
